original_title: Elderly patients abandoned at NHSL; hospital faces shortage of attendants
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The National Hospital of Sri Lanka is being inconvenienced due to a shortage of attendants at the hospital.

"This is because there have been several instances where the elderly patients brought in for treatment in the 1990 Suwaseriya ambulance service being abandoned at the hospital," Deputy Director at the National Hospital Dr. Rukshan Bellana said.
"This has resulted in the patients remaining at the hospital even after recovery," he said.
"Smaller hospitals in the villages where these elderly people are from, have refused to accept them as well," he adds.
